title: Why do people hate black-eyed peas? - Quora

response.answer_text: The YouTube-based music critic Anthony Fantano once did a video in which he discussed people’s suggestions for the most annoying songs. He noticed that the suggestions usually had two things in common: they were 1) catchy and 2) void of any other merit. The point was that not all catchy songs necessarily become annoying, even if they are played a lot. Sometimes they have additional details in the music and lyrics that make repeated listens rewarding. Instead, songs tend to become annoying when they are catchy and become popular (and thus get played a lot) but don’t reward these repeated listens and instead become tiresome, if not irritating. The Black-Eyed Peas weren’t mentioned but I think that describes them rather well. At their best, they wrote catchy throwaway pop-rap songs that you put on for a party atmosphere. But the songs were never musically interesting, and the lyrics were lowest-common denominator when they weren’t being outright dreadful (“I met a girl down at the disco / She said hey hey hey ya let’s go”). Hate is too strong a word, but other than the times I had a fleeting interest in some of their hits, they were never my cup of tea. Another angle of criticism came from those who saw pop rap in general as a betrayal of what hip hop was supposed to be. They believed hip hop needed to be an edgy, anti-commercial genre. This has faded in the years since, as more pop music has been influenced by hip hop.

Do they? Are you sure? I love, at least I really like Black-Eyed Peas. There even used to be, perhaps still is, a restaurant “The Black Eyed Pea” and I love their entire menu. I’ve never met anyone, not a single person, who hate Black-Eyed peas. Now you can say you know at least one person (me) who loves Black-Eyed Peas!
